au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikChain3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikChain3D

  • public class FabrikChain3D
extends Object
    Class to represent a 3D Inverse Kinematics (IK) chain that can be solved for a given target using the FABRIK algorithm.

    A FabrikChain3D consists primarily of a list of connected FabrikBone3D objects, and a number of parameters which keep track of settings related to how we go about solving the IK chain.

    Version:
    0.4 - 29/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Method Detail

      • addBone

        public void addBone(FabrikBone3D bone)
        Add a bone to the end of this IK chain of this FabrikChain3D object.

        This chain's mChainLength property is updated to take into account the length of the new bone added to the chain.

        In addition, if the bone being added is the very first bone, then this chain's mFixedBaseLocation property is set from the start joint location of the bone.

        Parameters:
        bone - The FabrikBone3D object to add to this FabrikChain3D.
        See Also:
        mChainLength, mFixedBaseLocation

      • addConsecutiveBone

        public void addConsecutiveBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                               float length)
        Add a bone to the end of this IK chain given the direction unit vector and length of the new bone to add.

        The bone added does not have any rotational constraints enforced, and will be drawn with a default colour of white at full opacity.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        If this method is provided with a direction unit vector of zero, or a bone length of zero then then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone
        length - The length of the new bone

      • addConsecutiveBone

        public void addConsecutiveBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                               float length,
                               Colour4f colour)
        Add a consecutive bone to the end of this IK chain given the direction unit vector and length of the new bone to add.

        The bone added does not have any rotational constraints enforced, and will be drawn with a default colour of white at full opacity.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        If this method is provided with a direction unit vector of zero, or a bone length of zero then then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone
        length - The length of the new bone
        colour - The colour with which to draw the bone

      • addConsecutiveFreelyRotatingHingedBone

        public void addConsecutiveFreelyRotatingHingedBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                                                   float length,
                                                   FabrikJoint3D.JointType jointType,
                                                   Vec3f hingeRotationAxis)
        Add a consecutive hinge constrained bone to the end of this chain. The bone may rotate freely about the hinge axis.

        The bone will be drawn with a default colour of white.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with a direction unit vector of zero, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint type requested is not JointType.LOCAL_HINGE or JointType.GLOBAL_HINGE then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If this method is provided with a hinge rotation axis unit vector of zero, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone.
        length - The length of the new bone.
        jointType - The type of hinge joint to be used - either JointType.LOCAL or JointType.GLOBAL.
        hingeRotationAxis - The axis about which the hinge joint freely rotates.

      • addConsecutiveFreelyRotatingHingedBone

        public void addConsecutiveFreelyRotatingHingedBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                                                   float length,
                                                   FabrikJoint3D.JointType jointType,
                                                   Vec3f hingeRotationAxis,
                                                   Colour4f colour)
        Add a consecutive hinge constrained bone to the end of this chain. The bone may rotate freely about the hinge axis.

        The bone will be drawn with a default colour of white.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with a direction unit vector of zero, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint type requested is not JointType.LOCAL_HINGE or JointType.GLOBAL_HINGE then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If this method is provided with a hinge rotation axis unit vector of zero, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone.
        length - The length of the new bone.
        jointType - The type of hinge joint to be used - either JointType.LOCAL or JointType.GLOBAL.
        hingeRotationAxis - The axis about which the hinge joint freely rotates.
        colour - The colour to draw the bone.

      • addConsecutiveHingedBone

        public void addConsecutiveHingedBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                                     float length,
                                     FabrikJoint3D.JointType jointType,
                                     Vec3f hingeRotationAxis,
                                     float clockwiseDegs,
                                     float anticlockwiseDegs,
                                     Vec3f hingeReferenceAxis,
                                     Colour4f colour)
        Add a consecutive hinge constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        The hinge type may be a global hinge where the rotation axis is specified in world-space, or a local hinge, where the rotation axis is relative to the previous bone in the chain.

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with bone direction or hinge constraint axis of zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint type requested is not LOCAL_HINGE or GLOBAL_HINGE then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone.
        length - The length of the new bone.
        jointType - The joint type of the new bone.
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        hingeRotationAxis - The axis about which the hinge rotates.
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        hingeReferenceAxis - The axis about which any clockwise/anticlockwise rotation constraints are enforced.
        colour - The colour to draw the bone.

      • addConsecutiveHingedBone

        public void addConsecutiveHingedBone(Vec3f directionUV,
                                     float length,
                                     FabrikJoint3D.JointType jointType,
                                     Vec3f hingeRotationAxis,
                                     float clockwiseDegs,
                                     float anticlockwiseDegs,
                                     Vec3f hingeConstraintReferenceAxis)
        Add a consecutive hinge constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        The hinge type may be a global hinge where the rotation axis is specified in world-space, or a local hinge, where the rotation axis is relative to the previous bone in the chain.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with bone direction or hinge constraint axis of zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint type requested is not LOCAL_HINGE or GLOBAL_HINGE then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        directionUV - The initial direction of the new bone.
        length - The length of the new bone.
        jointType - The joint type of the new bone.
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        hingeRotationAxis - The axis about which the hinge rotates.
        clockwiseDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        anticlockwiseDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        hingeConstraintReferenceAxis - The reference axis about which any clockwise/anticlockwise rotation constraints are enforced.

      • addConsecutiveRotorConstrainedBone

        public void addConsecutiveRotorConstrainedBone(Vec3f boneDirectionUV,
                                               float boneLength,
                                               float constraintAngleDegs,
                                               Colour4f colour)
        Add a consecutive rotor (i.e. ball joint) constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with bone direction or hinge constraint axis of zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        boneDirectionUV - The initial direction unit vector of the new bone.
        boneLength - The length of the new bone.
        constraintAngleDegs - The rotor constraint angle of the new bone.
        colour - The colour to draw the bone.

      • addConsecutiveRotorConstrainedBone

        public void addConsecutiveRotorConstrainedBone(Vec3f boneDirectionUV,
                                               float boneLength,
                                               float constraintAngleDegs)
        Add a consecutive rotor (i.e. ball joint) constrained bone to the end of this IK chain.

        The bone will be drawn in white at full opacity by default. This method can only be used when the IK chain contains a basebone, as without it we do not have a start location for this bone (i.e. the end location of the previous bone).

        If this method is executed on a chain which does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If this method is provided with bone direction or hinge constraint axis of zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint type requested is not LOCAL_HINGE or GLOBAL_HINGE then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        boneDirectionUV - The initial direction unit vector of the new bone.
        boneLength - The length of the new bone.
        constraintAngleDegs - The rotor constraint angle for of the new bone.

      • getBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV

        public Vec3f getBaseboneRelativeConstraintUV()
        Return the basebone relative unit vector of this chain. This direction is updated by the FabrikStructure3D when this chain is connected to another chain. There is no other possible way of doing it as we have no knowledge of other chains, but the structure does, allowing us to calculate this relative constraint UV.
        Returns:
        The basebone relative constraint UV as updated (on solve) by the structure containing this chain.

      • getBaseboneConstraintType

        public FabrikChain3D.BaseboneConstraintType3D getBaseboneConstraintType()
        Return the basebone constraint type of this chain.
        Returns:
        The basebone constraint type of this chain.

      • setConstraintLineWidth

        public void setConstraintLineWidth(float lineWidth)
        Method to set the line width (in pixels) with which to draw any constraint lines.

        Valid values are 1.0f to 32.0f inclusive, although the OpenGL standard specifies that only line widths of 1.0f are guaranteed to work. Values outside of this range will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        lineWidth - The width of the line used to draw constraint lines.

      • getBaseboneConstraintUV

        public Vec3f getBaseboneConstraintUV()
        Get the directional constraint of the basebone.

        If the basebone is not constrained then a RuntimeException is thrown. If you wish to check whether the basebone of this IK chain is constrained you may use the getBaseboneConstraintType() method.

        Returns:
        The global directional constraint unit vector of the basebone of this IK chain.

      • getBaseLocation

        public Vec3f getBaseLocation()
        Return the base location of the IK chain.

        Regardless of how many bones are contained in the chain, the base location is always the start location of the first bone in the chain.

        This method does not return the mBaseLocation property of this chain because the start location of the basebone may be more up-to-date due to a moving 'fixed' location.

        Returns:
        The location of the start joint of the first bone in this chain.

      • getBone

        public FabrikBone3D getBone(int boneNumber)
        Return a bone by its zero-indexed location in the IK chain.
        Parameters:
        boneNumber - The number of the bone to return from the Vector of FabrikBone3D objects.
        Returns:
        The specified bone.

      • getChain

        public List<FabrikBone3D> getChain()
        Return the List%lt;FabrikBone3D%gt; which comprises the actual IK chain of this FabrikChain3D object.
        Returns:
        The List%lt;FabrikBone3D%gt; which comprises the actual IK chain of this FabrikChain3D object.

      • getChainLength

        public float getChainLength()
        Return the current length of the IK chain.

        This method does not dynamically re-calculate the length of the chain - it merely returns the previously calculated chain length, which gets updated each time a bone is added or removed from the chain. However, as the chain length is updated whenever necessary this should be fine.

        If you need a calculated-on-the-fly value for the chain length, then use the getLiveChainLength() method.

        Returns:
        The pre-calculated length of the IK chain as stored in the mChainLength property.

      • getConnectedBoneNumber

        public int getConnectedBoneNumber()
        Return the index of the bone in another chain that this this chain is connected to.

        Returns -1 (default) if this chain is not connected to another chain.

        Returns:
        The zero-indexed number of the bone we are connected to in the chain we are connected to.

      • getConnectedChainNumber

        public int getConnectedChainNumber()
        Return the index of the chain in a FabrikStructure3D that this this chain is connected to.

        Returns -1 (default) if this chain is not connected to another chain.

        Returns:
        The zero-index number of the chain we are connected to.

      • getEffectorLocation

        public Vec3f getEffectorLocation()
        Return the location of the end effector in the IK chain.

        Regardless of how many bones are contained in the chain, the end effector is always the end location of the final bone in the chain.

        Returns:
        The location of this chain's end effector.

      • getLastTargetLocation

        public Vec3f getLastTargetLocation()
        Return the target of the last solve attempt.

        The target location and the effector location are not necessarily at the same location unless the chain has been solved for distance, and even then they are still likely to be similar rather than identical values.

        Returns:
        The target location of the last solve attempt.

      • getLiveChainLength

        public float getLiveChainLength()
        Return the live calculated length of the chain. Typically, the getChainLength() can be called which returns the length of the chain as updated / recalculated when a bone is added or removed from the chain (which is significantly faster as it doesn't require recalculation), but sometimes it may be useful to get the definitive most up-to-date chain length so you can check if operations being performed have altered the chain length - hence this method.
        Returns:
        The 'live' (i.e. calculated from scratch) length of the chain.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the name of this IK chain.
        Returns:
        The name of this IK chain.

      • getNumBones

        public int getNumBones()
        Return the number of bones in this IK chain.
        Returns:
        The number of bones in this IK chain.

      • removeBone

        public void removeBone(int boneNumber)
        Remove a bone from this IK chain by its zero-indexed location in the chain.

        This chain's mChainLength property is updated to take into account the new chain length.

        If the bone number to be removed does not exist in the chain then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        boneNumber - The zero-indexed bone to remove from this IK chain.

      • setRotorBaseboneConstraint

        public void setRotorBaseboneConstraint(FabrikChain3D.BaseboneConstraintType3D rotorType,
                                       Vec3f constraintAxis,
                                       float angleDegs)
        Set this chain to have a rotor basebone constraint.

        Depending on whether the constraint type is GLOBAL_ROTOR or LOCAL_ROTOR the constraint will be applied about global space or about the local coordinate system of a bone in another chain that this chain is attached to.

        The angle provided should be between the range of 0.0f (completely constrained) to 180.0f (completely free to rotate). Values outside of this range will be clamped to the relevant minimum or maximum.

        If this chain does not contain a basebone then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the constraint axis is a zero vector or the rotor type is not GLOBAL_ROTOR or LOCAL_ROTOR then then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        rotorType - The type of constraint to apply, this may be GLOBAL_ROTOR or LOCAL_ROTOR.
        constraintAxis - The axis about which the rotor applies.
        angleDegs - The angle about the constraint axis to limit movement in degrees.

      • setHingeBaseboneConstraint

        public void setHingeBaseboneConstraint(FabrikChain3D.BaseboneConstraintType3D hingeType,
                                       Vec3f hingeRotationAxis,
                                       float cwConstraintDegs,
                                       float acwConstraintDegs,
                                       Vec3f hingeReferenceAxis)
        Set this chain to have a hinged basebone constraint.

        If the number of bones in this chain is zero (i.e. it does not contain a basebone) then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the hinge rotation or reference axes are zero vectors then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the hinge reference axis does not lie in the plane of the hinge rotation axis (that is, they are not perpendicular) then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        hingeType - The type of constraint to apply, this may be GLOBAL_HINGE or LOCAL_HINGE.
        hingeRotationAxis - The axis about which the global hinge rotates.
        cwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle about the hinge reference axis in degrees.
        acwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle about the hinge reference axis in degrees.
        hingeReferenceAxis - The axis (perpendicular to the hinge rotation axis) about which the constraint angles apply.

      • setFreelyRotatingGlobalHingedBasebone

        public void setFreelyRotatingGlobalHingedBasebone(Vec3f hingeRotationAxis)
        Set this chain to have a freely rotating globally hinged basebone.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles are automatically set to 180 degrees and the hinge reference axis is generated to be any vector perpendicular to the hinge rotation axis.

        If the number of bones in this chain is zero (i.e. it does not contain a basebone) then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the hinge rotation axis are zero vectors then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        hingeRotationAxis - The world-space axis about which the global hinge rotates.

      • setFreelyRotatingLocalHingedBasebone

        public void setFreelyRotatingLocalHingedBasebone(Vec3f hingeRotationAxis)
        Set this chain to have a freely rotating globally hinged basebone.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles are automatically set to 180 degrees and the hinge reference axis is generated to be any vector perpendicular to the hinge rotation axis.

        If the number of bones in this chain is zero (i.e. it does not contain a basebone) then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the hinge rotation axis are zero vectors then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        hingeRotationAxis - The world-space axis about which the global hinge rotates.

      • setLocalHingedBasebone

        public void setLocalHingedBasebone(Vec3f hingeRotationAxis,
                                   float cwDegs,
                                   float acwDegs,
                                   Vec3f hingeReferenceAxis)
        Set this chain to have a freely rotating globally hinged basebone.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles are automatically set to 180 degrees and the hinge reference axis is generated to be any vector perpendicular to the hinge rotation axis.

        If the number of bones in this chain is zero (i.e. it does not contain a basebone) then a RuntimeException is thrown. If the hinge rotation axis are zero vectors then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        hingeRotationAxis - The local axis about which the hinge rotates.
        cwDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        acwDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        hingeReferenceAxis - The local reference axis about which the hinge is constrained.

      • setBaseboneConstraintUV

        public void setBaseboneConstraintUV(Vec3f constraintUV)
        Set a directional constraint for the basebone.

        This method constrains the basebone (only) to a global direction unit vector.

        Attempting to set the basebone constraint when the bone has a basebone constraint type of NONE or providing a constraint vector of zero will result will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        constraintUV - The direction unit vector to constrain the basebone to.
        See Also:
        FabrikJoint3D.setBallJointConstraintDegs(float angleDegs), FabrikJoint3D.setHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs(float), FabrikJoint3D.setHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float)

      • setBaseLocation

        public void setBaseLocation(Vec3f baseLocation)
        Method used to move the base location of a chain relative to its connection point.

        The assignment is made by reference so that this base location and the location where we attach to the other chain are the same Vec3f object.

        Note: If this chain is attached to another chain then this 'fixed' base location will be updated as and when the connection point in the chain we are attached to moves.

        Parameters:
        baseLocation - The fixed base location for this chain.

      • connectToStructure

        public void connectToStructure(FabrikStructure3D structure,
                               int chainNumber,
                               int boneNumber)
        Connect this chain to the specified bone in the specified chain in the provided structure.

        In order to connect this chain to another chain, both chains must exist within the same structure.

        If the structure does not contain the specified chain or bone then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        structure - The structure which contains the chain which contains the bone to connect to.
        chainNumber - The zero-indexed number of the chain in the structure to connect to.
        boneNumber - The zero-indexed number of the bone in the chain to connect to.

      • setFixedBaseMode

        public void setFixedBaseMode(boolean value)
        Set the fixed basebone mode for this chain.

        If the basebone is 'fixed' in place, then its start location cannot move. The bone is still allowed to rotate, with or without constraints.

        Specifying a non-fixed base location while this chain is connected to another chain will result in a RuntimeException being thrown.

        Fixing the basebone's start location in place and constraining to a global absolute direction are mutually exclusive. Disabling fixed base mode while the chain's constraint type is BaseboneConstraintType3D.GLOBAL_ABSOLUTE will result in a RuntimeException being thrown. *

        Parameters:
        value - Whether or not to fix the basebone start location in place.

      • setMaxIterationAttempts

        public void setMaxIterationAttempts(int maxIterations)
        Set the maximum number of attempts that will be made to solve this IK chain.

        The FABRIK algorithm may require more than a single pass in order to solve a given IK chain for an acceptable distance threshold. If we reach this iteration limit then we stop attempting to solve the IK chain. Further details on this topic are provided in the mMaxIterationAttempts documentation.

        If a maxIterations value of less than 1 is provided then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown, as we must make at least a single attempt to solve an IK chain.

        Parameters:
        maxIterations - The maximum number of attempts that will be made to solve this IK chain.

      • setMinIterationChange

        public void setMinIterationChange(float minIterationChange)
        Set the minimum iteration change before we dynamically abort any further attempts to solve this IK chain.

        If the latest solution found has changed by less than this amount then we consider the progress being made to be not worth the computational effort and dynamically abort any further attempt to solve the chain for the current target to minimise CPU usage.

        If a minIterationChange value of less than zero is specified then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        minIterationChange - The minimum change in solve distance from one iteration to the next.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this chain, capped to 100 characters if required.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to set.

      • setSolveDistanceThreshold

        public void setSolveDistanceThreshold(float solveDistance)
        Set the distance threshold within which we consider the IK chain to be successfully solved.

        If a solve distance value of less than zero is specified then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        solveDistance - The distance between the end effector of this IK chain and target within which we will accept the solution.

      • setColour

        public void setColour(Colour4f colour)
        Set the colour of all bones in this chain to the specified colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour to set all bones in this chain.

      • updateTarget

        public float updateTarget(float targetX,
                          float targetY,
                          float targetZ)
        Method to solve this IK chain for the given target location.

        The end result of running this method is that the IK chain configuration is updated.

        To minimuse CPU usage, this method dynamically aborts if: - The solve distance (i.e. distance between the end effector and the target) is below the mSolveDistanceThreshold, - A solution incrementally improves on the previous solution by less than the mMinIterationChange, or - The number of attempts to solve the IK chain exceeds the mMaxIterationAttempts.

        Parameters:
        targetX - The x location of the target
        targetY - The y location of the target
        targetZ - The z location of the target
        Returns:
        The resulting distance between the end effector and the new target location after solving the IK chain.

      • updateTarget

        public float updateTarget(Vec3f newTarget)
        Method to solve this IK chain for the given target location.

        The end result of running this method is that the IK chain configuration is updated.

        To minimuse CPU usage, this method dynamically aborts if: - The solve distance (i.e. distance between the end effector and the target) is below the mSolveDistanceThreshold, - A solution incrementally improves on the previous solution by less than the mMinIterationChange, or - The number of attempts to solve the IK chain exceeds the mMaxIterationAttempts.

        Parameters:
        newTarget - The location of the target for which we will solve this IK chain.
        Returns:
        float The resulting distance between the end effector and the new target location after solving the IK chain.
